data.title: September 2019 ‚Äì Michelle Leigh Writes
data.meta_description: 9 posts published by michelleleighwrites during September 2019
data.text:
USA network released it‚Äôs new show, Pearson this Summer. My girl Bethany Joy Lenz plays Keri Allen- city attorney and right hand woman to Chicago‚Äôs mayor Bobby Novak.

In the show she is not only feisty and sarcastic, but she borders the line between right and wrong both in her professional and in her personal life. As we soon find out that she is THAT girl who is sleeping with her boss.

HOWEVER, she is an intelligent, hard working, diligent woman who has gotten to where she is by her own merit. And her fear is that being with Bobby (Mayor Novak) is not only hurting her reputation but also breaking up a marriage and a family.

Although you can see the pain that has been created due to this affair, we do find out that Bobby pursued her when he and his wife were separated. Yea yea same old story, different characters. So many #Scandal vibes up. in. here. I love it.

Keri is a badass, she doesn‚Äôt take crap from anyone, and she is somehow unapologetic for her actions. I mean personally I don‚Äôt LOVE that she‚Äôs the other woman. I think it is very black and white, separated or not, he has a ring on his finger girl. AND let‚Äôs be VERY clear here, she may have slept with a married man and continued to fall into some twisted relationship with him, but HE is the married man who kept pursuing her. Just as much as it is her responsibility to check for a ring, it‚Äôs his to know he wears it and that ring is attached to a another woman he made promises to, a woman he had children with. Bobby is being sleazy. No doubt about it. But you can tell the affair wasn‚Äôt something Keri planned. And she let it go on for so long because falling in love with her boss was just kind of something that happened along the way and something she felt she couldn‚Äôt help.

Needless to say things get juicy and shit GOES DOWN as the season is coming to a close. And Keri is always trying to as Novak likes to say, ‚ÄúKeep her hands clean.‚Äù He doesn‚Äôt want her involved in all his behind the scenes, illegal drama. Enter- Jessica Pearson, the woman, the myth, the legend.

In order to get shit done, Keri has to be comfortable to do that. And from looking over some of her fashion in the show. I realized there are some things she seems to be drawn to.

CLOTHING

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

Simple, classic, timeless pieces- such as high waisted trousers, turtlenecks, blazers, button down shirts, and trench coats.

A lot of business attire.

Neutral colors-blacks, grays, whites, browns, navy, light blues, etc.

In her down time I‚Äôve seen her rock jeans and a button up or a simple LBD (Little Black Dress).

ACCESSORIES & NAILS

Not many. At all.

I‚Äôve noticed she mostly wears simple studs and a watch.

IF she happens to wear a necklace it is often something simple and delicate.

Her nails are usually a very natural color too.

HAIR & MAKEUP

Keri keeps it very natural. She almost has that No Makeup, Makeup look.

I feel like she sticks to colors that just kind of enhance the natural colors in her features.

However, every so often she may throw on a red lip, and it adds that extra pop.

As for her hair she keeps that classic too. Just some simple twists or power pony‚Äôs. Or some soft curls.

My Keri Allen Inspired Look:

Based off this look.

I pulled this black blazer from my closet, that has some striped print when you roll the sleeves, I thought it was similar to Keri‚Äôs style. Black dress pants that have a higher waist line, and a white button down shirt.

I couldn‚Äôt really see her shoes in any of the shots, but I feel like you can‚Äôt go wrong with a trusty black pump.

I work in a much more relaxed environment so I can wear jeans and sneakers. But after dressing in Keri‚Äôs style for a minute, I kind of liked the classic look. It was fun, put me in an office! Actually no, I‚Äôd never want an office job, I feel like an office style would be too restricting for me. I like to dress comfortable, and funky at times, Lol.

The Comparison‚Ä¶How did I do?

Do you like Keri Allen‚Äôs classic style? Visit this site and shop her clothes!

The Pearson Season 1 finale airs this Wednesday @ 10 PM on the USA Network.

Check your local listings!

-<3-

*I do not take credit for the Keri/Jessica/Pearson stills/gifs/ video clips used.*

*All other images are my own.*

TELEVISION

!!!!! SPOILERS AHEAD !!!!!

Jane The Virgin [Premiered it‚Äôs 5th and Last Season]

CRAZY SHOUT OUT TO THIS QUEEN for this INSANE 7 minute monologue done in one continuous shot! Gina Rodriguez is EPIC! Please give her all the awards. I remember watching this and just being in complete awe of her. Her acting was complete and total brilliance. Read about the process of shooting this scene HERE

I‚Äôm a total TV nerd, who loves to plan and who loves a good theme. I do this often. Here‚Äôs my Jane the Virgin finale setup. Yes, I do this just for me. And I freaking LOVE IT!

Allow me to explain.

My set up includes:

A flower (Jane‚Äôs grandma‚Äôs virginity metaphor) Haha.

White petals to symbolize her moments with Rafael.

Snowballs to symbolize the title of Jane‚Äôs first novel- Snow Falling and her life with Michael.

A cross necklace to symbolize the strong faith this show has and it‚Äôs also a necklace I think Jane has worn in earlier seasons.

A soap opera digest as a ode to the show‚Äôs telenovela nature.

A lavender drink and tablecloth because it‚Äôs Rogelio‚Äôs favorite color.

And lastly the meal that just screams Villanueva- a grilled cheese sandwich.

Oh and I made a ratchet t-shirt of course with my favorite quote. Because duh?

The finale episode made me laugh, made me cry, made me gasp. But mostly it made me realize how much I‚Äôm going to miss this show. Excellent, television. A true game changer. Thank you. Can‚Äôt wait for the spinoff!

Always knew these two were endgame.

My girl, Sophia Bush even guest starred this season! üòÄ

Grand Hotel

This show premiered this Summer and honestly it had me hooked. It‚Äôs mysterious, and romantic and full of drama. I hope it gets a season 2, because I just watched the finale and it was bringing the plot twists left and right! Also I think there are many familiar faces involved.

P.S. did I mention the ROMANCE!

The Bachelorette (Hannah B‚Äôs Season) / Bachelor in Paradise

Why am I so invested in these cheap, reality shows! I am so convinced it is heavily scripted, but I can‚Äôt take my eyes away. It‚Äôs like a cringeworthy car crash. I have not watched The Bachelor franchise in years. I think I may have watched the first season of The Bachelorette and that is all. But I kept seeing all this drama surrounding Hannah B.‚Äôs season and I just got curious and binge-watched it on demand, getting all caught up before home town visits. PETER WAS MY FAVORITE! And as for Hannah, I did like her, but sometimes I found myself screaming at her on my tv too. She definitely had her badass, female empowerment moments too though. So you do you Hannah Boo. Girl is going to be on this Season‚Äôs Dancing with the Stars. Like‚Ä¶what? Crazy! She‚Äôs everywhere!

PILOT PETE!!!!!! #Windmill #JesusStillLovesMe

I had a little party for the finale. I was so nervous while watching. I wanted her to pick Peter SOOOO bad, but if you watched you know she didn‚Äôt. So fingers crossed that he is the next bachelor! #SIGNMEUP #IDGIVEHIMALLTHEROSES

And then after that ended Bachelor in Paradise started up‚Ä¶and I didn‚Äôt even know this was a thing. Various past contestants get to come back and get another shot at finding love as they stay on a beach in Mexico. So I was like what the hell? Why not. Some of the guys from Hannah‚Äôs season were on so I was like woohoo, #SummerTV. Connor, Dylan, Mike, Luke S. were on and some others too. And it is so dramatic and I feel so frustrated watching it, but I can‚Äôt help it. It‚Äôs entertaining as hell. LOL. My fav couples are Katie & Chris and Clay and Nicole. I just hope they end up together. I also really loved Derek who was from a different season but he is no longer on. The finale is next week and then we get a reunion show, SO HEYYYY!!!! And the next Bachelor is announced. What do we think guys, do those ankles from that new promo look like Peter‚Äôs? I sure hope so!

BH 90210

When I heard about this reboot, I WAS ESTATIC. When I heard about the concept, not so much. I was nervous, and skeptical. I wanted to love it, but I was scared I wouldn‚Äôt. But‚Ä¶it is actually SO DAMN GOOD. This take on the reboot trend is fresh and inventive. I‚Äôm so sad it‚Äôs only 6 episodes. The season finale is tonight! I hope they bring it back for season 2! It‚Äôs so funny, nostalgic and oddly mysterious. It makes my heart happy to see the crew back together. Although I must say‚Ä¶Luke Perry will always be missed.

I may have been a bit young to watch 90210 from the start. But I remember being obsessed with the reruns so much I ran out and bought the first season on DVD. From 90210 where this dream boat waltzed in as Dylan McKay and made girls everywhere swoon. I was unable to decide if I liked him more with Brenda or with Kelly because he made both relationships look so good. To the original Buffy the Vampire Slayer movie where he was once again the adorable love interest. To when he guest starred on old pal ‚ÄúKelly‚Äôs‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat I Like About You‚Äù show. To his most recent role as Fred Andrew‚Äôs on CWs hit Riverdale. I‚Äôve followed his career and have always loved him. My heart is broken to know he is gone. üíî I still can‚Äôt believe it. Rest in Peace Luke Perry. You‚Äôll always be a legend. #DylanMckay

I had a little fun premiere party with my sister in law, so I thought why not honor the peach pit, by bringing in some peach vibes‚Ä¶I also rocked this 90210 shirt I made from an old shirt that didn‚Äôt fit anymore. I cut out the logo and sewed it to a white tee, that I cropped and made tie.

Pearson [Premiered it‚Äôs 1st season on USA]

You know why I‚Äôm watching this‚Ä¶.my girl Bethany Joy Lenz plays Keri Allen!

I was never a ‚ÄúSUITS‚Äù viewer, but I know this is a spin-off based on Jessica Pearson from the show. It is a bit hard to get fully invested in at times, because I honestly just want to see Joy on my screen at all times. LOL. But she does play a vital role. She plays city attorney and left hand woman to Chicago‚Äôs mayor Bobby Novak‚Ä¶whom she is having an on going affair with. It‚Äôs steamy and sexy and SAD‚Ä¶because there are so many complications and so many times you just want to scream at Keri for being THAT GIRL. But tv is NEVER just right or wrong, Pearson explores the Gray. The Gray in Law, in Politics, and in Love. I AM HERE FOR IT! The finale is next week. So I‚Äôm excited, I hope it gets a season 2! Because I really like seeing both Jessica Pearson and Keri Allen be kickass, powerful women BOSSES.

Keri & Bobby THO!!!! #SWOON

Had a little Pearson Premiere Party because I‚Äôm a tv geek and I love Joy. So my best friend and I got together to watch.

Younger [Premiered it‚Äôs 6th Season]

I fell in love with this show, when it first premiered. And I mean Hilary Duff‚Ä¶duh?

The finale just aired and this season was full of crazy twists and turns and lots of laughs. But of course in the land of Charles & Liza vs. Liza & Josh. I am all about #TEAMJOSH. Season 7 COMING SOON!

Stranger Things [Premiered it‚Äôs 3rd Season on Netflix]

It‚Äôs been a minute since Season 2! I‚Äôm a little sad that this season is only 8 episodes. I am currently up to 6. And I have to say it‚Äôs not my favorite season. But there has definitely been some really good stuff so far. So I‚Äôm excited to see all that goes down in the upside down and the real world parallels.

I went to Coney Island this Summer and it was all decked out in promotion for the show. AND Baskin Robbins released special ice cream flavors for the show too! Eleven‚Äôs Heaven (White), Upside Down Pralines (Chocolate). They were amazing! Especially the Eleven‚Äôs Heaven, it had waffle cone pieces in it. #HEAVEN

In The Dark [This wasn‚Äôt exactly a summer show, but I have yet to talk about it on this blog, so I just wanted to give it a shout out, because it is so good.] A really unique storyline that follows a blind girl who becomes obsessed with the death of a close friend, and takes it upon herself to get him some justice. She is a real fire cracker who hands out insults often, loves smoking and generally hates life. But somehow, you just end up falling in love with her clever angsty wit. I was happy to hear it was picked up for a second season!

Plus‚Ä¶there‚Äôs this guy‚Ä¶what a dreamboat. Casey Deidrick who played Chad on Days of Our Lives and Tommy in an MTV show ‚ÄúEye Candy‚Äù that got cancelled, when it shouldn‚Äôt have.

Scream (Season 3, not sure when this premiered on tv‚Ä¶I just saw it pop up on Netflix and got super excited.)

Seasons 1 &2 were pretty good, I used to love the original slasher films as a kid. I thought they were mysterious and scary. That and I Know What You Did Last Summer were slasher jams growing up in the 90‚Äôs/00‚Äôs. So I was hyped to see they FINALLY released a Season 3 after all the confusion and cast changes. The plot twist was nice! I was happy that they played with the audience, I was all over the place as to who the killer was. It was only 6 episodes, so I finished it in like 2 days. But with Halloween coming up, it‚Äôs perfect to get into the spooky spirit.

Here‚Äôs the trailer if your interested.

So there you have it, my Summer TV recap. Check ‚Äôem out!

And tell me what you watched this Summer!

*The only photos that I take credit for are the ‚ÄúPremiere Party‚Äù photos.*

-<3-

MUSIC

Tori Kelly

Inspired by True Events [released August 2019]

So I actually saw Tori back in April for the her Acoustic Sessions- where she not only performed songs from her incredible Gospel album ‚ÄúHiding Place‚Äù, but also a lot of unreleased music that she just recently released in this new project.

And holy crap‚Ä¶what an absolute masterpiece. Not only are the songs/lyrics incredible‚Ä¶ but the concept ‚ÄúInspired by True Events‚Äù is so beautiful and personal. She wrote from personal memories and she even included voice clips of her younger self. It‚Äôs just so amazing.

My favorite tracks are, Coffee, 2 Places, Kid I Used To Know, and Pretty Fades.

Shawn Mendes

Self titled album [released May 2018‚Ä¶but it‚Äôs been releasing new material well into this year.]

My favorite tracks include, Senorita, If I Can‚Äôt Have You, Fallin‚Äô All In You, Where Were You In The Morning, Nervous, Particular Taste [Gives me serious Prince vibes!], Mutual, Queen and When You‚Äôre Ready [That‚Äôs like the whole album LOLOL, omg I told you I LOVE his music.]

The Shawn Mendes Tour

I saw Shawn in concert at Barclay‚Äôs Center on August 23rd. I randomly bought tickets because it dawned on me how much I love his music- I‚Äôve been listening since Handwritten, yo! I also became obsessed with his new single ‚ÄúIf I Can‚Äôt Have You.‚Äù So my friend and I were super excited to get our cougar on, and go and sing our asses off with all the little teens. Fun Fact: we were those some older girls a few years back when we went to see Justin Bieber. Haha.

However, I promised you the full concert experience story so here it goes‚Ä¶

Shawn Mendes was AMAZING! Such a stinking cutie pie. I know I have a few years on him, but I have such a stinking crush on this cutie! If only I was 21 again. üòâ Boy can SING! And his music is so damn good. I kind of was hoping for a Camila Cabello surprise, but she wasn‚Äôt there. He did do a short mash up of Senorita/I Know What You Did Last Summer, but we definitely missed Camila. He shortened the songs significantly. He also surprised us with a coldplay cover and a FREAKIN WHITNEY HOUSTON cover. LIKE BOY‚Ä¶.WHAT? He definitely put on a great show.

BUT had it not been for one sweet woman who exchanged our seats for closer ones, I think I might have had a panic attack in that arena in the upper level. I had purchased tickets in section 206, because frankly it was all I could afford. The structure is INSANELY dangerous. Walking up those stairs was terrifying. I just tried to keep my cool, because it would have been very easy to let my anxiety take over. But I knew I had to keep it together, if I had any chance of enjoying the show.

My friend has a fear of heights (which sadly I did not know, otherwise I never would have bought those seats!) and so I realized quickly we needed to do something. Thankfully she came up with the idea to see if we could get our seats changed. And so the craziness continued. Not only did the venue let us in later than they should (seriously how do they expect thousands of people to be seated in 10-15 minutes/security check alone was like 10!), and they let us in a weird side entrance where we could not catch an elevator, escalators weren‚Äôt working and there was no one really telling us where to go. We had to walk up flights of stairs to get to our seats, not to mention that you had to walk a marathon to get food. All of this drama, causing so many people to miss the opening act- Alessia Cara. I heard her and caught a few bits, she was AMAZING. WHAT A DAMN VOICE. SHE SANG ‚ÄúHow Far I‚Äôll Go‚Äù from MOANA! #FEELS

I have to say in an emergency situation, I would not have felt safe in that arena. It just seemed like no one cared.

Anyway once we let Alessia‚Äôs set finish, I knew we had a small window to change our situation before Shawn took the stage. So my friend and I had to look for an usher, yes WE HAD TO LOOK FOR THEM, and ask if we could get our seats changed. I have to be honest, I didn‚Äôt think that was a thing. But my friend was like, we have to try, and she was right, the longer we sat up in those steep seats, the scarier it got. We definitely would not have felt safe to get up, let alone dance.

So the usher (although nice) told us he couldn‚Äôt help us and to go to guest services, to which the man there kept ignoring our complaints stating, ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt have a disability,‚Äù so he can‚Äôt help me. I was pissed.

So finally another woman told us to try the box office. We get to the box office and they tell us to go to guest services, and I was like ‚Äúno, we were just there, they sent us here.‚Äù She almost told us there‚Äôs nothing they can do, that all we can do is purchase ANOTHER ticket. MIND you those nose bleeds seats COSTED $85. I was like ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs insane, we paid to be here, and we can‚Äôt sit there, I‚Äôm not asking you to give me some crazy front row seats, we just have to get out of ours.‚Äù The woman was very understanding, but you could tell she was not sure if she could help us, claiming that guest services keeps sending people to her. So, this is not the first complaint they‚Äôve gotten. If you have vertigo, you‚Äôd probably pass out up there. I mean I myself almost had a panic attack up there, it was so scary. Anway, the woman came back a few minutes later with two tickets, saying, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs your lucky day.‚Äù And it got me thinking, how many people who complained weren‚Äôt THAT lucky.

There really should be a change made. I know we are not the first people to complain about the steep seating. Not to mention that Barclays Center actually has a policy that says special accommodations can be made at the venue day of. I understand anxiety may not be a disability, but it IS real. We happen to get ‚Äúlucky‚Äù that the seats we were given were being saved for someone who didn‚Äôt show. We went from section 206 to 124, and it was AMAZING. We were able to dance freely and enjoy the rest of our night‚Ä¶thankfully. Just out of curiosity I looked up our tickets‚Ä¶and they were about $200+. THAT‚Äôs INSANE. I guess safety costs! HUH?

I‚Äôll just leave this article HERE. Because I am not the only one who feels this way. Concerts are supposed to be a fun experience not a dangerous one. (And no I wasn‚Äôt drinking, (and my friend barely finished hers because she got so anxious from the seating) I can only imagine how many people have fallen because of the combination of alcohol and steep seating.)

^ The left we were sitting way high up in the nose bleeds. The right we were in our new seats.^

From all these pictures you would never know the kind of concert experience we had! I may not be a fan of the venue, but I am a fan of the very sweet woman who accommodated us when no one else would. I will NEVER purchase tickets that high up again, and if this venue wasn‚Äôt so convenient for me to go to, I probably would never purchase tickets there again at all. An unforgettable night for sure, a list of things that went wrong. But girl, we hung in and we conquered it! #FightForYourHealth #Memories #AnxietyIsReal #SafetyIsAPriority

Shawn is a class act, the arena lit up beautifully with everyone wearing the bracelets they gave us as we walked in. And Shawn barely ever left the stage, performing an epic 23 song set! He is an insane talent. THAT is what I am choosing to focus on, that in the end, we were STILL able to have a good time. I just hope that Barclays takes measures to create a safer environment for concert goers.

Set list (via setlist.fm)

Lost in Japan

There‚Äôs Nothing Holdin‚Äô Me Back

Nervous

Stitches

Se√±orita / I Know What You Did Last Summer

Mutual

Bad Reputation

Never Be Alone

B-Stage:

I Wanna Dance With Somebody (Who Loves Me)

(Whitney Houston cover)

A Little Too Much / Because I Had You / Patience / When You‚Äôre Ready

Life of the Party

Like to Be You

Ruin

A-Stage:

Treat You Better

Particular Taste

Where Were You in the Morning?

Fallin‚Äô All in You

Youth

If I Can‚Äôt Have You

Why

Mercy

Encore:

Fix You

(Coldplay cover)

In My Blood

By the way‚Ä¶Here was my concert going outfit. I was really excited about it!

I basically just wanted an all black base so I could rock this funky kimono. And of course I did gold jewelry and gold nails. Mind you, I was on a budget and this WHOLE outfit (aside from the bag and jewelry which I already had) costed me about $40! I think it kinda turned out pretty cool! üôÇ

Taylor Swift

Lover [released August 2019]

We know how I feel about this new album!

***** 5 Stars!!!

My favorite tracks include- I Forgot That You Existed, The Man, I Think He Knows, False God & Afterglow. But honestly I love every single track. Her lyrics are GOLD! She truly was born to do this!

Ed Sheeran

No. 6 Collaborations Project [released July 2019]

Some of my favorite tracks are Beautiful People ft. Khalid, South of the Border ft. Camila Cabello & Cardi B., I Don‚Äôt Care with Justin Bieber (of course cuz it‚Äôs a JAM!), I Don‚Äôt Want Your Money ft. H.E.R, Put It All On Me ft. Ella Mai [this gives me suchBlackstreet & Mya-‚ÄúTake me there‚Äù/City High ‚ÄúWhat would you do‚Äù vibes and the very beginning of this track is very ‚ÄúMy whole life has changed‚Äù by Ginuwine.

Ok so I know I‚Äôve been sleeping on this album and I‚Äôm kind of mad at myself because I consider myself an Ed Sheeran fan. He is actually on my concert bucket list, along with Taylor Swift, Bruno Mars and Joy Williams (previously known as 1/2 of The Civil Wars). I had given it a quick listen one day, but didn‚Äôt really let it sink in, but recently I have just been playing it at random times, and I mean I totally dig the concept of creating a full album of collabs. He really collaborated with such a variety of artists and he killed it. He really can do anything. Such an incredible artist. I‚Äôm just going to leave you with this Dublin concert video, because I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve watched this in the past‚Ä¶.him and a loop pedal‚Ä¶EPIC!

The Jonas Brothers

Happiness Begins [released June 2019]

So this was a THING! The brothers reunited musically after being separated for the past 6 years. I wasn‚Äôt A HUGE DIE HARD fan of the JoBros, but I did vibe with them and their music. I LOVED their A Little Bit Longer Album and I‚Äôve loved their solo music too. When I heard they reunited, my boy band loving heart was HAPPY. If tickets were cheaper, I‚Äôd probably go see them just to fill my boy band void. #IMLOOKINGATYOU*NSYNC

My favorite tracks include, Sucker (OBVI‚Ä¶it‚Äôs a damn BOP!), Only Human (loved it before it was a single), I Believe, Used To Be, and Rollercoaster.

I really like this album. Do it JOBROS! I know it‚Äôs been a minute, but I love that they are brothers/family first.

You can listen to these albums on Spotify, iTunes, YouTube, etc.

*I do not take credit for any album art used.*

*All other images are my own.*

-<3-

I know I haven‚Äôt posted much this summer‚Ä¶ I guess I‚Äôve just been busy‚Ä¶

LIVIN MY BEST LIFE! üòâ

As this Summer officially comes to an end for me, (I start work back up tomorrow!) it has dawned on me that this Summer has been pretty great. Which is not always the case for me. No, I wasn‚Äôt able to go on some luxurious vacation, but I was able to have some really fun times with great family, friends, food, and lots of wine! üòâ I got to do more than I usually get to, because this summer I decided to take off of work. Granted, my job is different then most, I can either apply to work the summer or not, it‚Äôs my choice. Normally I work every Summer, but something made me decline this Summer. And I‚Äôm glad I did. My credit card isn‚Äôt happy, but I think it was the right move for me personally.

No my Summer wasn‚Äôt perfect, it actually started off really difficult for me and my family. And I have had many emotional moments and hard times, but when I look at all the good. Somehow, that wins. Good always wins. And so, I thought before I jump back into my usual work routine, I should just take a second and reflect of the Summer memories I was blessed with.

JUNE, JULY, & AUGUST 2019

My Summer started with my usual tradition of taking my mom to see a broadway show. I get her tickets for her Mother‚Äôs Day gift and then we usually see the show in June. This year we saw Waitress, and it was ABSOLUTELY amazing. [Fun Fact: I actually just watched the movie and it was good, but I LOVED the play even more!)]

4th of July we celebrated with some family and it was really sweltering hot, but it was a really great time. As an anxious person, heat really tends to effect me. But I‚Äôve really learned to manage my anxiety in the Summer better. The 4th was really fun! Especially since my cousin and his family were in from Florida. It was really nice to be able to spend a holiday with them, it‚Äôs been a minute! I also found this super simple COOKIE RECIPE, and they were a hit! I think I made them, like 3 times for 3 separate occasions this summer, I just switch up the sprinkles depending on the occasion. A kid favorite for sure! *You could totally make these for Fall, Halloween, Christmas, Easter, etc. I would even like to try it with chocolate cake mix. BTW if you look closely, you may spy that I wore a Britney Spears t-shirt‚Ä¶it was the only red, white, & blue I had. And like I was cool with it! üòâ #ITSBRITNEYBITCH Guess you can tell, I‚Äôm kind of a graphic tee fan‚Ä¶more to come on that later on!

A Stranger Things themed Coney Island! So if you are a fan of the sci fi/mystery Netflix show, you would know that this Summer Season 3 was released. [I‚ÄôM ONLY UP TO EPISODE 6‚Ä¶SHHHHH!!!!] Coney Island was transformed into a Stranger Things theme park in the show‚Äôs 80‚Äôs fashion. It consisted of just posters hung around of the logo and the characters, the theme song was placing on the speakers, and the staff had on custom tees. Nothing crazy, I was kind of disappointed. BUT I went with my mom, aunt and my aunt surprised us by bringing my goddaughter, so we got to go on some rides, play games, and eat some food court summer food.

Local Baseball Game for my Cousin‚Äôs husband‚Äôs 40th birthday! I‚Äôm not a super fan of baseball, but we had a box room, and there was catered food, and the weather was great. The kids even got to run the bases after the game.

I got to catch up with my coworkers‚Ä¶and eat this load of calories! üòõ

Atlantic City Overnighter with my fav ladies, my mom and my aunt! We stopped in the small town Smithville on the way. Gambling isn‚Äôt my fav, because I HATE losing money. But there were a few fun games I liked, like CRAZY MONEY! BUT I got some sweet Gilmore Girls/Stars Hollow vibes from the small, quaint town, and picked up some goodies.

TOY STORY 4! THE LION KING! ALADDIN! #RELIVEDMYCHILDHOOD Thank you!

So I never had a super strong connection to The Lion King or Aladdin as a kid. I was never a super big Disney kid, I had my favorites but they weren‚Äôt it. But I really had to see the new live action films. Because, duh? However, Toy Story was a thing! My brother and I were a fan of the films growing up.

I really enjoyed all three films.

[INSERT MINI MOVIE REVIEWS!]

The Lion King was a little bittersweet because I felt like Nala being played by Beyonc√© kept taking me out of the story, because I was just thinking ok you‚Äôre Beyonc√©. And I just felt annoyed by it. And I just felt like the real animals (although Timon and Pumbaa were HYSTERICAL) were just weird to watch in this sing along world. I felt like the color in the animation helped with suspending reality and enjoying the world. But I did enjoy it for the most part, the original is better, in my opinion. The music was better in the original too.

Aladdin was amazing! I loved the romance between Aladdin and Jasmine. You know me, if there‚Äôs a love story, I AM IN IT! I thought Jasmine‚Äôs vocals were INSANE. And Will Smith as the genie‚Ä¶.I mean he cracked me up the whole damn time. The music was beautiful‚Ä¶And I watched a crappy boot leg copy because by the time, I got around to watching it, it wasn‚Äôt playing in theaters near me. But I really loved it, and if I watched it in a clear, crisp copy, I‚Äôd probably love it even more.

Toy Story 4 was EPIC! It was everything-emotional, funny, nostalgic, scary‚Ä¶.like those dummy dolls were legit! It was amazing and I actually didn‚Äôt think the ending was as sad as everyone made it. I think it actually left room for other films.

Family Day at the Aquarium! We got caught in torrential down pour, but it was still a good time!

Speaking of rain, I think I got caught in crazy down pours and thundering and lightning like 4-5 times this summer. I‚Äôve been soaked from head to toe on multiple occasions. One time my umbrella wouldn‚Äôt even open! Some days I could laugh it off and some I just wanted to stop and cry! But looking back at this summer I can just say Thank You! Thank You 2019 for getting me through some really hard emotional blocks, and testing me and proving to me that I can handle so much more than I give myself credit for. Anxiety does not define me. And just because I feel the weight of the world one day or even a week doesn‚Äôt mean that it‚Äôs forever. That my funky moods, don‚Äôt have to be my all day moods! I‚Äôm so hoping to bring that knowledge with me into this new Fall Season‚Ä¶MY FAVORITE SEASON! Such a basic bi*ch, I know! #FIGHTME. üòâ BRING ON THE PUMPKIN EVERYTHANG, the flannel, the leather, the cool air, the crisp leaves and the HOLIDAYS! I feel so blessed to have had the Summer I did.
